explanations.machine learning: The paper explicitly mentions the use of machine learning methods (decision tree, k-nearest neighbor, and support vector machine) to classify financial risk tolerance.
explanations.supervised learning: The study involves labeled data (risk-averse, risk-neutral, risk-loving) and uses classification methods, which are part of supervised learning.
explanations.classification: The paper focuses on classifying participants into risk categories (risk-averse, risk-neutral, risk-loving) using machine learning methods.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper mentions the use of support vector machine (SVM) as one of the classification methods.
explanations.SVM: SVM is an abbreviation for support vector machine, which is used in the study for classification.
explanations.decision tree: The paper mentions the use of decision tree as one of the classification methods and highlights its performance in the study.
